revised_title: Investigation of the Depression of the Filament of Maximum Velocity in a Stream Flowing through an Open Channel
tldr: The author investigates the depression of the filament of maximum velocity in a stream flowing through an open channel and proposes a theory based on eddy formation and transverse currents. The phenomenon is explained by the curvature of the water surface profile and the resulting tendency for water to flow from the center to the sides of the channel, creating a system of transverse currents that depress the filament of maximum velocity.
